tit.e: The Ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace
tit.cmt: 用語集に登録されている訳語に修正しました。また、史跡を表す場合、通常 ruin は、複数形になるようですので、修正しました。
tit.e: The Ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace

sen.j: 紫香楽宮跡（しがらきぐうし、しがらきのみやあと）とは、滋賀県甲賀市信楽町黄瀬・牧に在る国史跡。
sen.e: The ruin of the Shigaraki Palace is the national historical site in Kinose and Maki, Shigaraki-cho Town, Koka City, Shiga Prefecture.
The ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace is a national historical site located in Kinose and Maki, Shigaraki-cho, Koka City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 用語集に登録されている訳語に修正しました。また、定冠詞を不定冠詞に修正しました。Shigaraki-cho Town は、Shigaraki-cho でよいと思います。
sen.e: The ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace is a national historical site located in Kinose and Maki, Shigaraki-cho, Koka City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 聖武天皇が天平17年（745年）に遷都した紫香楽宮（しがらきのみや）の跡に比定された。
sen.e: It was designated as the ruin of the Shigaraki Palace which was built by Emperor Shomu when the capital was moved to Shiragaki in 745.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was considered as the ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace to where the Emperor Shomu moved the capital in 745.
sen.cmt: 用語集に登録されている訳語に修正し、天皇名に定冠詞を付けました。
sen.e: It was considered as the ruins of Shigaraki no Miya Palace to where the Emperor Shomu moved the capital in 745.

sen.j: 大正15年（1926年）に史跡として約33000mに指定された。
sen.e: 33,000 square meters where the ruin is located was then designated as a historic site in 1926.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: 33,000 square meters of the site were designated as a historic site in 1926.
sen.cmt: 原文の「33000m」は、「33000㎡」と判断しました。
sen.e: 33,000 square meters of the site were designated as a historic site in 1926.

sen.j: しかし、現在では東大寺に先駆けて紫香楽宮で大仏建立を行った甲賀寺または近江国国分寺跡と推測される。
sen.e: However, now it is assumed that the ruin is Koga-dera Temple or Omi provincial Kokubun-ji Temple which had been built for a Great Buddha before Todai-ji Temple was built.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, now it is assumed that the ruins are Koga-ji Temple or Kokubun-ji Temple of Omi Province which had been built for a Great Buddha in Shigaraki no Miya Palace before Todai-ji Temple was built.
sen.cmt: 「甲賀寺」について、用語集に登録されている訳語に修正しました。
sen.e: However, now it is assumed that the ruins are Koga-ji Temple or Kokubun-ji Temple of Omi Province which had been built for a Great Buddha in Shigaraki no Miya Palace before Todai-ji Temple was built.

sen.j: 実際には同町宮町で紫香楽宮の跡（宮町遺跡）が発掘されている。
sen.e: Another ruin was actually found as the Shigaraki no Miya Palace (Miyamachi site) in Miyamachi, Shigaraki-cho Town.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Another ruins were actually found as Shigaraki no Miya Palace (Miyamachi site) in Miyamachi, Shigaraki-cho.

sen.e: Another ruins were actually found as Shigaraki no Miya Palace (Miyamachi site) in Miyamachi, Shigaraki-cho.

sen.j: また、信楽には地元の伝承で、勅旨にも保良宮があったという話もある。
sen.e: It is said that there was Horanomiya Palace in Chokushi, Shigaraki-cho Town according to the lore in this area.

sen.j: この遺跡では、300あまりの礎石が残るなど遺構の保全状態は良好であり、礎石の配列から東大寺の伽藍配置と同様の建物配置を持つこと。
sen.e: The remains on this site including over 300 foundation stones are preserved in good condition and the placement of the foundation stones shows that the layout of the temple was the same as the one of the Buddhist temple placement in Todai-ji Temple.

The ancient structural remnants of this site (including over 300 foundation stones) are preserved in good condition, and the placement of the foundation stones shows that the layout of the temple was the same as the one of the Buddhist temple placement in Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 前半部分を修正しました。
sen.e: The ancient structural remnants of this site (including over 300 foundation stones) are preserved in good condition, and the placement of the foundation stones shows that the layout of the temple was the same as the one of the Buddhist temple placement in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: この史跡から出土している軒丸瓦が3種類、軒平瓦が2種類の内、創建期とされる瓦がある。
sen.e: Three kinds of the round-shaped roof tiles and two kinds of flat roof tiles for eaves were found on this site and some of them are considered as the ones created during the foundation period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Three kinds of the round-shaped roof tiles and two kinds of flat roof tiles for eaves were found on this site and some of them are considered as the ones created during the foundation period.
Three kinds of the round-shaped roof tiles and two kinds of flat roof tiles for eaves were found on this site and some of them are considered as the ones created during the foundation period.

sen.j: これらは、恭仁宮大極殿造営に際して新調された瓦をモチーフとした単弁十七葉蓮華文の軒丸瓦と均整唐草文の軒平瓦である。
sen.e: The round-shaped roof tiles have the motif of Tanbenjunanayorengemon (lotus flower) and the flat roof tiles have the motif of Kinseikarakusamon (arabesque), and both of the motifs were created when Kuninomiya Palace was built.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。「単弁十七葉蓮華文」は"Tanbenjunanayorengemon"としました
sen.e: The round-shaped roof tiles have the motif of Tanbenjunanayorengemon (lotus flower) and the flat roof tiles have the motif of Kinseikarakusamon (arabesque), and both of the motifs were created when Kuninomiya Palace was built.

sen.j: 恭仁宮廃都後に建立された山城国分寺の塔跡と同笵瓦であることが確認されていることから、寺院であることは疑いない。
sen.e: It is identified that these tiles and the tiles found in the ruin of Yamashirokokubunji-Temple which was built after the Kuninomiya was ruined, were made with the same mold, and therefore there is no doubt that the ruin of Shigarakinomiya Palace was the ruin of a temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。原文解釈困難だったため、「山城国分寺の瓦が紫香楽宮跡の瓦と同笵瓦であったたため、紫香楽宮跡が寺院であることは疑いない」というふうに訳し、原文そのように変えました。
sen.e: It is identified that these tiles and the tiles found in the Yamashiro Kokubun-ji historic remain which was built after the Kuninomiya was ruined, were made with the same mold, and therefore there is no doubt that the Shigaraki no Miya Palace was a temple.
sen.cmt: 「山城国分寺」の訳を用語集の訳にあわせました。後半部分も少し書き換えました。

sen.j: 遺跡の北東約600mには平成12年（2000年）～14年（2002年）にかけて、新名神高速道路建設に関連して発掘された鍛冶屋敷遺跡が有る。
sen.e: About 600 meters northeast of this site, the remain of black smith was dug from 2000 to 2002 in connection with the project of Shinmeishin high way construction.
At about 600 meters northeast of this site, the remains of the residence of smith, which had been dug from 2000 to 2002 in the construction of Shin Meishin Expressway, are located.
